form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Coons (for himself, Mr. Portman, Ms. Ayotte, and Mr. Peters) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To expand benefits to the families of public safety officers who suffer fatal climate-related injuries sustained in the line of duty and proximately resulting in death.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fairness for Fallen Officers Act of 2015.

section.header: Benefits for families of public safety officers who suffer fatal climate-related injuries
section.text: Section 1201 of title I of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 (42 U.S.C. 3796) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b), by inserting or climate-related injury (as defined in subsection (l)) after personal injury;

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking or vascular rupture and inserting vascular rupture, or climate-related injury;
in paragraph (1)(A), by inserting exposure to extreme environmental conditions, after disaster relief,;
in paragraph (2), by striking or vascular rupture and inserting vascular rupture, or climate-related injury;
in paragraph (3), by striking or vascular rupture and inserting vascular rupture, or climate-related injury; and
in the flush text following paragraph (3), by striking or vascular rupture and inserting vascular rupture, or climate-related injury; and

paragraph.text: by amending subsection (l) to read as follows:
the term climate-related injury means an injury that is caused by an environmental condition experienced by an officer, including hypothermia, heatstroke, and hyperthermia; and
the term nonroutine stressful or strenuous physical excludes actions of a clerical, administrative, or nonmanual nature.
